title: Waterloo Fiber & Magical Mix Kids 2023 | Video | kwwl.com
text: Waterloo Fiber & Magical Mix Kids 2023 Weather Alert ...Blizzard Conditions Continue into Saturday... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected Saturday into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa into Saturday. This dangerous storm will continue to bring additional light snow across much of the state tonight and tomorrow with additional accumulations generally an inch or less through Saturday. Winds will continue to increase, with life threatening blizzard conditions at least into Saturday central and north. Dangerous temperatures follow into the weekend through early next week, with wind chill values down to 45 below zero expected. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of up to an inch or two. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero at times. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and northeast Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 PM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Saturday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Iowa Department of Transportation reports travel not advised across much of central Iowa this evening, with some roads impassable due to blowing and drifting snow. Towing is not recommended over the much of the area so you may be stranded if an accident occurs. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511. && ...Blizzard Conditions Continue into Saturday... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected Saturday into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa into Saturday.
